results.title: News digest [No. 14]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “News digest”.
Magazine items: 14-day commando course in cliff-climbing and descents for a C.M.F. company; “Frostbite regatta” - hardy all year yachtsmen race in eight-foot sabots on Waranga Reservoir in Northern Victoria; “Four in one” - a Carlton Methodist church where the service may be followed in Spanish, Italian, Hungarian and English, thus assisting migrants’ integration; “Whirlybird weapon” - helicopters used to spray crops in the Mallee prove their reliability; “Bouncing Babies” - veteran cars prove their reliability during a lively car trial.

results.title: News digest [No. 13]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Money makers produce decimal coins at Bendigo; Mt. Scurvy will disappear if quarrying continues by 1984; Tuna - a new catch in new nets off the Gippsland Lakes worth 8,000 pounds per annum; two kinds of art - Eskimos stone carvings and needlework; Erwen Ponds clear spring water attracts divers and grows huge water lilies.

results.title: Viewpoint on Sydney
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Sydney, New South Wales, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. It is seen as a big exciting city with many contrasts. Job opportunities are discussed as well as other advantages and disadvantages of living in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Vietnam: people and war (D)
results.brief_description: A report on the war in Vietnam (1966). Superimposed on internal rivalry and political tension, it involves not only the people who fight it but also the people who cannot escape it. Scenes of the guerilla type warfare, the ramsacking of villages and rebel street fighting, resulting in the needless suffering of the aged, women and children set the pattern of a brutal war. Reporter: Michael Charlton. NB: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING IMAGES.

results.title: Videotape editing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television training film”
Describes techniques of editing in videotape recording for television. Commencing with part of a live studio program being recorded on tape and passing on to a detailed description of how video tape recording machines work.

results.title: The Vice President
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
Elevation to the position of Vice-President brings prestige responsibility and freedoms of action, but it also means a shifting of loyalties and the losing of personal contact. This is shown in the dramatised story of John Harvard who rising from Branch Director to Vice-President finds himself having to put pressure on the men who a short time ago were his near equals. Only by going against their wishes can he serve the best interests of his company.

results.title: Vic Greenaway: production potter
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Vic Greenaway is an accomplished potter with his ceramic workshop set in the cournty where he works with two apprentices. Pottery for him is a lifetime work, a total commitment requiring all his energies and concentration.

results.title: Verdict at 1.32
results.creator_credit: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and International Temperance Society
results.brief_description: Dramatically depicts the effects of alcohol, stressing that consuming even the smallest quantities of alcohol can be dangerous. Tells the story of a young secretary who has two cocktails while out to lunch with her fiance. Her reaction dulled when driving back to work, she cannot brake in time and is killed, killing another person, also an alcoholic. Subsequently both their brains are examined by a neurologist; and the effects of alcohol on reaction times and normal co-ordination, convincingly demonstrated at a physiology lecture and a sports car gymkhana.
